t: Psalm 132
The Lord Has Chosen Zion
A Song of Ascents.
Remember,*pn O Lord,*s in David’s favor, all*ld the hardships he endured,
how*ln he swore to the Lord*s and*ld vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob,
“I*ln will not enter my house or*ld get into my bed,
I*ln will not give sleep to my eyes or*ld slumber to my eyelids,
until*ln I find a place for the Lord,*s a*ld dwelling place for the Mighty One of Jacob.”
Behold,*pn we heard of it in Ephrathah; we*ld found it in the fields of Jaar.
“Let*ln us go to his dwelling place; let*ld us worship at his footstool!”
Arise,*pn O Lord,*s and go to your resting place, you*ld and the ark of your might.
Let*ln your priests be clothed with righteousness, and*ld let your saints shout for joy.
For*ln the sake of your servant David, do*ld not turn away the face of your anointed one.
The*pn Lord*s swore to David a sure oath from*ld which he will not turn back: “One*ln of the sons of your body I*ld will set on your throne.
If*ln your sons keep my covenant and*ld my testimonies that I shall teach them, their*ln sons also forever shall*ld sit on your throne.”
For*pn the Lord*s has chosen Zion; he*ld has desired it for his dwelling place:
“This*ln is my resting place forever; here*ld I will dwell, for I have desired it.
I*ln will abundantly bless her provisions; I*ld will satisfy her poor with bread.
Her*ln priests I will clothe with salvation, and*ld her saints will shout for joy.
There*ln I will make a horn to sprout for David; I*ld have prepared a lamp for my anointed.
His*ln enemies I will clothe with shame, but*ld on him his crown will shine.”
